metadata.title: CVE-2022-3550 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability classified as critical was found in X.org Server. Affectedby this vulnerability is the function _GetCountedString of the filexkb/xkb.c. The manipulation leads to buffer overflow. It is recommended toapply a patch to fix this issue. The associated identifier of thisvulnerability is VDB-211051.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3550` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xdmx - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.12
xdmx-tools - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.12
xmir - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.12
xnest - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.12
xorg-server-source - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.12
xserver-common - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.12
xserver-xephyr - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.12
xserver-xorg-core - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.12
xserver-xorg-legacy - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.12
xserver-xorg-xmir - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.12
xvfb - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.12
xwayland - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.12
No subscription required

xorg-server-source-hwe-18.04 - 2:1.20.8-2ubuntu2.2~18.04.8
xserver-xephyr-hwe-18.04 - 2:1.20.8-2ubuntu2.2~18.04.8
xserver-xorg-core-hwe-18.04 - 2:1.20.8-2ubuntu2.2~18.04.8
xserver-xorg-legacy-hwe-18.04 - 2:1.20.8-2ubuntu2.2~18.04.8
xwayland-hwe-18.04 - 2:1.20.8-2ubuntu2.2~18.04.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xorg-server package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.12').
xorg-server-hwe-18.04 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.20.8-2ubuntu2.2~18.04.8').
